title: In class 9, I got 70%. Can I score 90% in the class 10 CBSE? - Quora
tags: Central Board of Secondary Education, India

response.answer_text: Yes you can. Why not? Your first statement has nothing to do with your 10th standard performance. There are a few tips that you can follow to improve your performance in 10th standard: The most important rule 'Listen to your classes' , make it a point to study whatever you can by listening to your teacher in the class itself. Half the work is done.Come home revise the topics taught to you everyday.Come the weekend. Consolidate what you have learnt in the week, revise everything once again. Now you might revise with ease.Have some doubts? Clear it then and there with your teacher. No need to shy away., ask your doubts, seek help if you cannot follow something.The golden rule to better memory, 'Write, write and write'. Writing and learning is the most effective form of learning.Keep your classworks, homeworks, records updated and filled. Do not underestimate their role in your final preparation.Attend the model exams designed by your school without fail even if it might get a little tedious, and you may not score well.Do not lose hope if you score lesser in your model exams. You will definitely perform better in your boards.Attend tuitions if it is extremely necessary. Evaluate your strengths and a little help would not harm.Eat well, sleep well and stay relaxed. Do not stress too much over the exam.View this exam as any other exam. It is just a casual exam. Do not risk your everything for this exam. Strategize and work effectively for the exam. You will definitely have a bright future ahead. My credentials would be I managed to score 93.6% in 10th boards CBSE in 2010. We had grades back then. Good luck!
